segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya sāvatthiṃ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
segments.en: Then Venerable Ānanda robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Sāvatthī for alms.

segments.pli: Addasā kho āyasmā ānando jāṇussoṇiṃ brāhmaṇaṃ sabbasetena vaḷavābhirathena sāvatthiyā niyyāyantaṃ.
segments.en: He saw the brahmin Jāṇussoṇi driving out of Sāvatthī in a splendid all-white chariot drawn by mares.

segments.pli: Setā sudaṃ assā yuttā honti setālaṅkārā, seto ratho, setaparivāro, setā rasmiyo, setā patodalaṭṭhi, setaṃ chattaṃ, setaṃ uṇhīsaṃ, setāni vatthāni, setā upāhanā, setāya sudaṃ vālabījaniyā bījīyati.
segments.en: The yoked horses were pure white, as were the ornaments, chariot, upholstery, reins, goad, and canopy. And his turban, robes, sandals were white, as was the chowry fanning him.
When people saw it they exclaimed,
It’s a vehicle fit for Brahmā!”

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Ānanda wandered for alms in Sāvatthī. After the meal, on his return from alms-round, he went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him what had happened, adding,

segments.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, bhante, pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya sāvatthiṃ piṇḍāya pāvisiṃ.
Addasaṃ khvāhaṃ, bhante, jāṇussoṇiṃ brāhmaṇaṃ sabbasetena vaḷavābhirathena sāvatthiyā niyyāyantaṃ.
Setā sudaṃ assā yuttā honti setālaṅkārā, seto ratho, setaparivāro, setā rasmiyo, setā patodalaṭṭhi, setaṃ chattaṃ, setaṃ uṇhīsaṃ, setāni vatthāni, setā upāhanā, setāya sudaṃ vālabījaniyā bījīyati.
Sakkā nu kho, bhante, imasmiṃ dhammavinaye brahmayānaṃ paññāpetun”ti?
segments.en: “Sir, can you point out a Brahmā vehicle in this teaching and training?”

segments.pli: “imasseva kho etaṃ, ānanda, ariyassa aṭṭhaṅgikassa maggassa adhivacanaṃ:
segments.en: “These are all terms for the noble eightfold path:
‘vehicle of Brahmā’, or else ‘vehicle of truth’, or else ‘supreme victory in battle’.

segments.pli: Sammādiṭṭhi, ānanda, bhāvitā bahulīkatā rāgavinayapariyosānā hoti, dosavinayapariyosānā hoti, mohavinayapariyosānā hoti.
segments.en: When right view is developed and cultivated it culminates with the removal of greed, hate, and delusion.

segments.pli: Sammāsaṅkappo, ānanda, bhāvito bahulīkato rāgavinayapariyosāno hoti, dosavinayapariyosāno hoti, mohavinayapariyosāno hoti.
Sammāvācā, ānanda, bhāvitā bahulīkatā rāgavinayapariyosānā hoti, dosa … pe … mohavinayapariyosānā hoti.
Sammākammanto, ānanda, bhāvito bahulīkato rāgavinayapariyosāno hoti, dosa … pe … mohavinayapariyosāno hoti.
Sammāājīvo, ānanda, bhāvito bahulīkato rāgavinayapariyosāno hoti, dosa … pe … mohavinayapariyosāno hoti.
Sammāvāyāmo, ānanda, bhāvito bahulīkato rāgavinayapariyosāno hoti, dosa … pe … mohavinayapariyosāno hoti.
Sammāsati, ānanda, bhāvitā bahulīkatā rāgavinayapariyosānā hoti, dosa … pe … mohavinayapariyosānā hoti.
Sammāsamādhi, ānanda, bhāvito bahulīkato rāgavinayapariyosāno hoti, dosa … pe … mohavinayapariyosāno hoti.
segments.en: right immersion is developed and cultivated it culminates with the removal of greed, hate, and delusion.

segments.pli: Iminā kho etaṃ, ānanda, pariyāyena veditabbaṃ yathā imassevetaṃ ariyassa aṭṭhaṅgikassa maggassa adhivacanaṃ:
segments.en: This is a way to understand how these are all terms for the noble eightfold path:
‘vehicle of Brahmā’, or else ‘vehicle of truth’, or else ‘supreme victory in battle’.”
That is what the Buddha said.

segments.pli: Idaṃ vatvāna sugato athāparaṃ etadavoca satthā:
segments.en: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
are always yoked to the shaft.
Conscience is its pole, mind its strap,
its axle is absorption, and energy its wheel.
Equanimity and immersion are the carriage-shaft,
as it rolls on to sanctuary.
The wise leave the world in it,

suttaplex.blurb: Ānanda  sees the brahmin Jāṇussoṇi resplendent on his all-white chariot. He asks the Buddha whether there is a similarly divine vehicle in Buddhism. The Buddha responds by drawing a detailed set of analogies between the eightfold path and a chariot.
